Author: lipstickwoes
Text: The thinnest I’ve ever been was living in the dorms. I was walking so much, eating a salad, soup, or roll of sushi for a whole day 90% of the time, and doing nothing but work out in between and after classes, because I was isolating myself at that point too and didn’t want to hang out with anyone. Make sure you invest in yourself and your health by building friendships and professional relationships! That’s my biggest regret, even though I obviously should have been relating to food better too.

Author: donout_disturb
Text: Me too. I'm moving out for uni in a year though. I dream about buying my own safe foods, not having binge triggering food in my house, fasting for days with no question asked... I really can't wait. I agree with you, restricting is a piece of cake when I'm in school because I have so much to worry about that I completely ignore eating.
